title: Implement worker registration and task execution
description:
Worker functions in client.gleam:26-40 are stubbed:
- new_worker() returns dummy ID
- start_worker_blocking() does nothing
- start_worker() returns empty closure

Required implementation:
1. Register worker with dispatcher via gRPC
2. Open persistent streaming channel for task polling
3. Implement heartbeat (every 4 seconds)
4. Execute task handlers with proper TaskContext
5. Send completion/failure events back

Depends on: gRPC implementation

Impact: CRITICAL - cannot execute any workflows.

title: Implement durable tasks with checkpoint mechanism
description:
DurableTaskDef type exists but has no implementation:
- Checkpoint key storage
- State persistence across restarts
- DurableContext with SleepFor() method

Python/Go have full durable task support with:
- Persistent sleep
- State checkpointing
- Resume after process restart

Impact: MEDIUM - durable workflows not supported.

title: Add missing TaskContext methods
description:
TaskContext is missing methods that Python/Go SDKs provide:
- spawn_workflow() - Execute child workflows
- stream() - Send streaming events
- refresh_timeout() - Extend execution timeout
- release_slot() - Signal early completion
- retry_count() - Get current retry attempt
- step_run_errors() - Get all step failures

Impact: MEDIUM - reduces SDK functionality.

title: Implement gRPC client for worker communication
description:
The Gleam SDK uses REST API only, but Hatchet requires gRPC for:
- Worker registration (GetActionListener)
- Task streaming (ListenV2)  
- Completion reporting (SendStepActionEvent)
- Workflow registration (PutWorkflow)

Research needed:
- Gleam gRPC libraries
- Erlang gRPC FFI options
- Protocol buffer generation for Gleam

Impact: CRITICAL - workers cannot function without gRPC.

title: Add config file and environment variable loading
description:
Python/Go SDKs load config from:
- client.yaml in working directory
- Environment variables (HATCHET_CLIENT_TOKEN, etc)
- JWT token parsing for server URL

Gleam SDK requires explicit host/token in code.

Impact: LOW - improves developer experience.

title: Implement sleep_ms function using gleam_erlang
description:
The sleep_ms function in run.gleam:302-304 currently does nothing (returns Nil). This breaks the await_result polling mechanism.

Fix: Use gleam_erlang/process.sleep() for actual sleep functionality.

Impact: CRITICAL - polling loops infinitely without this fix.

title: Add TLS/mTLS support for secure connections
description:
Python/Go SDKs support:
- TLS encryption
- mTLS (mutual TLS) authentication
- Certificate configuration

Current Gleam SDK uses plain HTTP only.

Impact: LOW - required for production deployments.
